title: Add shell-init support for fish
description:
Implement first-class fish shell integration for wt shell-init.

Scope and tasks:
- Extend wt shell-init to accept fish.
- Add a fish init template in src/commands/shell_init.zig that preserves behavior expectations:
  - intercept wt new
  - run wt new --porcelain
  - on success plus valid directory, change into the new worktree
  - print a concise confirmation line
  - pass through all other subcommands to the binary
- Ensure stderr/stdout routing remains correct for porcelain behavior.
- Add or expand unit tests for fish template output and key behavior markers.
- Add or expand CLI argument validation tests to include fish as supported.
- Update README shell integration section with fish setup instructions and guarded snippets that are safe when wt is not on PATH.
- Update README supported-shells statement and troubleshooting notes.
- Confirm wt shell-init fish output is usable in fish startup config (config.fish).
- Run mise run test and fix regressions.

Acceptance criteria:
- wt shell-init fish succeeds.
- Unsupported-shell error message includes fish in the supported set.
- README documents fish setup and verification.
- Tests cover fish support and pass.

title: [zli-swap] Update tests/docs for zli swap (minimal, KISS)

title: Expand CI with platform matrix and compile/runtime gates
description:
Follow-up to wt-8mi platform testing strategy.

Implement pragmatic platform coverage in automation:
- Add a CI matrix for ubuntu-latest, macos-latest, and windows-latest running `mise run test`.
- Add a cross-target compile gate using `mise run build:all` (at least on ubuntu-latest).
- Add a convenience mise task `check:platform` that aggregates lint/test/build:all for local and CI use.
- Keep rollout incremental; avoid PTY harness work in this task.

Acceptance criteria:
- Workflow covers Linux, macOS, and Windows test execution.
- Cross-target compile check runs in CI.
- `mise run check:platform` exists and runs successfully locally.
- Docs/reference updated where needed to point contributors at the new gate.

title: Configure GitHub repository topics

- Topics are visible on the GitHub repository page.

title: Windows target build fails due POSIX termios usage
description: Running "mise exec -- zig build -Dtarget=x86_64-windows" fails. In /Users/jlgeering/src/wt/src/commands/rm.zig (around lines 102-120) and /Users/jlgeering/src/wt/src/commands/init.zig (around lines 49-59), POSIX termios APIs (std.posix.tcgetattr, tcsetattr, std.c.V) are referenced unconditionally. On Windows targets this triggers compile errors (including libc dependency and invalid termios type), breaking the advertised Windows build path.

title: [zli-swap] Preserve current CLI behavior and normal exit semantics
description: Validate command behavior parity for list/new/rm/init/shell-init (args, success/failure paths, stdout/stderr intent) with normal exit codes; adjust command dispatch as needed.

title: wt list does not mark current worktree when run from subdirectories
description: wt list compares getCwdAlloc directly to each worktree root path. Running from a nested directory inside the current worktree fails to mark any row as current. Expected: resolve current worktree root (for example via git rev-parse --show-toplevel) and compare roots.

title: wt new reports existing worktree for non-worktree path collisions
description: wt new currently treats any existing filesystem path at the computed target as an existing worktree and exits success. If a plain directory already exists at that path, the command gives a false success result and downstream shell wrappers may attempt to cd into a path that was never registered as a git worktree. Expected: verify membership in git worktree list --porcelain before returning success; otherwise fail with a clear collision error.

title: Evaluate internal subcommands (__new/__list) instead of --porcelain flags
description:
Context
- Internal wrappers currently depend on --porcelain output from public commands.
- There is interest in replacing that with explicit internal commands like __new and __list.

Goal
- Decide whether moving machine interfaces to internal subcommands improves code clarity and UX boundaries.

Design options
1. Keep --porcelain and mark hidden/internal.
2. Add internal-only subcommands (__new, __list), remove porcelain from public commands.
3. Hybrid: keep porcelain temporarily with deprecation path to internal subcommands.

Evaluation criteria
- Clear separation between user-facing UX and internal automation contract.
- Parser/handler simplicity (shared logic without duplicated branching).
- Testability of machine output behavior.
- Backward compatibility for existing wrappers.

Acceptance criteria
- Decision documented (short ADR or decision note) with chosen option and rationale.
- If subcommands are chosen, public help no longer exposes machine interface flags.
- Integration tests cover wrapper-facing command contract.

title: Implement cross-shell parity integration tests for shell-init wrappers
description: Add integration coverage validating parity for zsh/bash/fish/nu wrappers: no-arg picker flow, new|add porcelain capture, relative-subdir preservation/fallback, and location-report behavior. Include CI-safe non-interactive checks to catch shell drift.

title: Validate .wt.toml setup paths to prevent traversal outside worktree roots
description:
## Summary
Setup operations in wt new accept arbitrary rel_path entries from .wt.toml without traversal checks. Paths containing .. can escape the intended repo/worktree roots for copy and symlink operations.

## Evidence
- copy path join without normalization guard: src/lib/setup.zig:27-30
- symlink path join without normalization guard: src/lib/setup.zig:97-100
- all configured paths executed directly: src/lib/setup.zig:178-186

## Expected
Reject or sanitize unsafe path entries (absolute paths, parent traversal) before filesystem operations.

## Risk
Unintended writes outside worktree boundaries when running configured setup.

title: Shell integration consistency and maintainability roadmap
description: Coordinate cross-shell behavior parity, shared completion/runtime logic, test coverage, and doc consistency for shell-init integrations (zsh, bash, fish, nu).

title: Add CI workflow for baseline checks
description:
Add GitHub Actions CI that runs the baseline quality gate via mise.

Acceptance criteria:

- Runs on pull_request and push to main.
- Executes mise install (or equivalent setup) and mise run check successfully.

title: Clarify that --porcelain is internal/unstable
description:
Context
- Current help advertises --porcelain as a general machine-readable mode.
- In practice this output is intended only for project shell wrappers and not a stable public interface.

Problem
- Publicly documented flag implies support/stability and invites external dependency on output shape.
- That increases compatibility burden for future output changes.

Proposed changes
- Update CLI help text to mark --porcelain as internal and unstable.
- Optionally hide it from normal help output if parser supports hidden flags.
- Add maintainer docs for wrapper expectations (where used and change policy).

Acceptance criteria
- wt list --help and wt new --help clearly indicate internal-only status, or flag is hidden.
- Maintainer-facing docs explain intended consumers and compatibility expectations.
- No behavior change for existing wrapper integrations.

description:
Implement first-class Nushell shell integration for wt shell-init.

Scope and tasks:

- Add a Nushell init template in src/commands/shell_init.zig that preserves behavior expectations:
  - intercept wt new
  - run wt new --porcelain
  - on success plus valid directory, change into the new worktree
  - print a concise confirmation line
  - pass through all other subcommands to the binary
- Ensure stderr/stdout routing remains correct for porcelain behavior.
- Add or expand unit tests for Nushell template output and key behavior markers.
- Add or expand CLI argument validation tests to include Nushell as supported.
- Update README shell integration section with Nushell setup instructions and guarded snippets where applicable.
- Update README supported-shells statement and troubleshooting notes.
- Confirm shell-init output is usable in Nushell startup config.
- Run mise run test and fix regressions.

Open decision to resolve during implementation:

Acceptance criteria:
- wt shell-init works for the chosen Nushell key.
- Unsupported-shell error message includes Nushell support.
- README documents Nushell setup and verification.
- Tests cover Nushell support and pass.

title: wt init Ctrl-C single-key cancel path is ineffective
description: /Users/jlgeering/src/wt/src/commands/init.zig includes Ctrl-C cancellation logic in decision parsing, but tryReadSingleKey does not disable ISIG in raw mode (around lines 49-56). On POSIX terminals, Ctrl-C is handled as SIGINT before user-space key handling, so the intended cancel flow does not execute. /Users/jlgeering/src/wt/src/commands/rm.zig sets ISIG=false; init.zig should mirror that behavior if Ctrl-C is intended as an in-flow cancel.

title: [zli-swap] Replace yazap with zli command wiring

description: Define and implement a tag-driven release flow for wt: cross-build supported targets, package assets with stable names, generate SHA256 sums, and publish to GitHub Releases. Include release notes structure and verification steps.

title: Remove file-based release version handoff in mise DAG
description: The new mise-native release pipeline writes the requested version to dist/release/.current-version so downstream tasks can read it. This works, but it is an implementation workaround for current task-argument propagation limits. Follow up by replacing this file-based handoff with a cleaner native task-arg contract when mise/task syntax supports reliable dependency arg forwarding, while preserving one-command release behavior (mise run release -- <X.Y.Z>).

title: Avoid /dev/tty redirection in shell wrappers
description: zsh/bash/fish shell-init wrappers route stderr as 2>/dev/tty during new|add porcelain capture. This can fail when no controlling TTY exists and bypasses caller redirection. Update wrappers to preserve stderr behavior across interactive and non-interactive contexts. Affected: src/commands/shell_init.zig (zsh,bash,fish new|add paths).

title: Make wt new setup execution cross-platform (Windows compatibility)
description:
## Summary
Setup execution relies on POSIX-specific tools (cp variants and sh -c). Windows builds may succeed, but setup actions from .wt.toml fail or behave inconsistently at runtime on Windows.

## Evidence
- copy command shells out to cp with POSIX flags: src/lib/setup.zig:54-58
- run commands execute via sh -c: src/lib/setup.zig:146-149

## Expected
Provide cross-platform setup execution behavior or document and gate unsupported platforms explicitly.

## Risk
Feature regression for Windows users: wt new setup semantics do not match docs.

title: wt rm can remove detached worktrees with unique commits without warning
description:
## Summary
wt rm currently skips local commit safety checks for detached worktrees. A detached worktree with unique commits can be classified as safe when clean and removed without confirmation.

## Evidence
- has_local_commits only computed when branch is non-null: src/commands/rm.zig:531-535
- safe classification uses has_local_commits flag: src/commands/rm.zig:537-546
- unsafe confirmation gate depends on safe flag: src/commands/rm.zig:624-648

## Expected
Detached worktrees should still trigger a local-commit safety check against main before non-force removal proceeds.

## Risk
Potential silent commit loss in detached worktrees.

Keep shell adapters thin and shell-specific only for rendering.

title: wt new treats tags/refs as existing branches
description: /Users/jlgeering/src/wt/src/commands/new.zig checks branch existence with "git rev-parse --verify <name>" (around line 49). This resolves tags and other refs, not just local branches. Repro: in a repo with tag "demo" and no branch "demo", "wt new --porcelain demo" creates a detached worktree instead of a branch-backed worktree. Branch checks should target refs/heads/<branch> explicitly.

title: Strengthen wt rm safety checks and confirmation flow
description: Enhance wt rm to detect unmerged commits before removal and require interactive confirmation for unsafe removals (dirty or unmerged) unless --force is provided.

title: Protect main branch with required checks

Acceptance criteria:

title: wt new resolves tags as branches and creates detached worktrees
description: Branch existence is checked with git rev-parse --verify NAME, which matches tags and other refs. When a tag matches the requested name, wt new logs Using existing branch but creates a detached worktree. Expected: validate against refs/heads/NAME or an equivalent branch-only check before taking the existing-branch path.

title: Shell completions omit supported 'nushell' alias for shell-init
description:
## Summary
wt shell-init accepts both nu and nushell, but generated completion suggestions only offer nu (zsh/bash/fish/nu completion sources), so one valid input is undiscoverable.

## Evidence
- Runtime accepts alias: src/commands/shell_init.zig:806
- Completion candidates generated from shell_name_choices (zsh bash fish nu)

## Expected
Completions should include every accepted shell alias, or runtime should reject undocumented aliases consistently.

## Scope
- zsh completion output
- bash completion output
- fish completion output
- nushell completion helper output
- tests asserting shell name completions
